aircraft.value: Phoenix Recon - AC-9127-331 at Maintenance Hub-Y

defect_observed.value: Pressure regulator drift. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.

root_cause.value: Vibration induced loosening of mechanical fasteners

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Air Conditioning component. Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.

corrective_action.value: Replace entire assembly due to extent of damage

preventive_action.value: Reduce inspection interval for affected component type

remarks_investigation.value: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.

remarks_design.value: Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions. Date: 22/07/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type. Date: 23/07/2023 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned. Date: 23/07/2023 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Quality aspects from regulatory perspective reviewed. Investigation methodology is comprehensive and acceptable. Date: 26/07/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound. Date: 31/07/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia

Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Pressure regulator drift. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Vibration induced loosening of mechanical fasteners
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Air Conditioning component. Functional
testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Replace entire assembly due to extent of damage

ii. Preventive Action: Reduce inspection interval for affected component type
